section.p: The configuration settings for the Log Agent are provided in the following file:
Below you find a detailed description of the individual settings.

section.title: monasca_log_api_url
section.p: Mandatory. The URL used to access the machine where the Service is installed.

section.title: keystone_api_url
section.p: Mandatory. The URL used to access the server where the OpenStack Keystone service is installed. The service is used for authenticating the user specified in username.

section.title: project_name
section.p: Mandatory. The name of the OpenStack project for which log data is to be retrieved by the agent.
Example: cmm

section.title: username
section.p: Mandatory. The user to be used for authenticating the agent against Keystone.
The user specified here must have the cmm-agent role in OpenStack and be assigned to the OpenStack project that is to be monitored by the agent. The project is specified in project_name.
It is recommended that this user is used only for configuration purposes and not for actually monitoring services and servers.
Example: admin-agent

section.title: password
section.p: Mandatory. The password of the user specified in username.

section.title: domain_id
section.p: Mandatory. The ID of the OpenStack Keystone domain to which the user specified in username is assigned.
Example: default

section.title: dimensions
section.p: Optional. Meta information to be collected with the log data that is retrieved by the agent. The information can be defined as an array.

The meta information defined by a dimension is attached to each log entry. It is represented as one or more fields in the log management dashboard. For the user who is working with the log data, dimensions provide additional filtering options.
Example: ['app_type:kafka', 'priority:high']

section.title: num_of_logs
section.p: Optional. The maximum number of logs per request that is sent to the Log API.
It is recommended that you check the number of logs you have to manage. The lower the maximum number of logs you specify, the higher the log management performance.
Allowed values: Any value above 0
Default: 125

section.title: max_data_size_kb
section.p: Optional. The maximum data load in kilobyte for sending a request to the Log API.
Allowed values: Any value above 0
Default: 5120

section.title: elapsed_time_sec
section.p: Optional. The time interval in seconds for sending logs to the Log API.
Logs are sent in the interval you specify provided that the maximum number of logs specified in num_of_logs or the maximum data load specified in max_data_size_kb is not reached earlier.
Allowed values: Any value above 0
Default: 30

section.title: delay
section.p: Optional. The delay time in seconds until it is checked whether the time interval specified in elapsed_time_sec is reached.
Allowed values: Any value above 0
Default: 10
